content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is launched by a spring of negligible mass along a horizontal surface of negligible friction. The spring constant of the spring is <math alttext="k" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The spring is initially compressed a distance <math alttext="x sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The block is released from rest. Some time after the block is released and travels in the direction shown in the figure, the spring compression is <math alttext="x sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following mathematical calculations can a student use to determine the speed <math alttext="v sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of the block at this new position?

choices.label: <math alttext="one half k, times x sub 0 squared, equals one half m, times v sub f squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></math>. Solve for <math alttext="v sub f" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math>.

<math alttext="one half k, times x sub 0 squared, equals one half k, times x sub f squared, plus one half m, times v sub f squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></math>. Solve for <math alttext="v sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="F in parallel times d, equals one half m, times delta v squared" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∥</mo></mrow></msub><mi>d</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math> and <math alttext="F in parallel, equals k x sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∥</mo></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> . Solve for <math alttext="delta v" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="F d cosine of theta, equals one half m, times delta v squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>d</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="F equals k x sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> . Solve for <math alttext="delta v" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="one half k, times x sub 0 squared, equals one half k, times x sub f squared, plus one half m, times v sub f squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></math>. Solve for <math alttext="v sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
